Answer: The parameters you need to pass in the main activity goChat(View? view?) would be the view that is clicked on. In your case, you can pass in the view that was clicked on in the onOptionsItemSelected method.

In your ChatHandler class, you can reference the main activity by using the Activity class's findViewById method. Here is how you can do it:

```java
public class ChatHandler {
    public void goChat(View view, Activity activity) {
        Log.v("GoChat", "Start");
        RelativeLayout mainLayout = (RelativeLayout) activity.findViewById(R.id.main_layout);
        LinearLayout ll = new LinearLayout(activity);
        ll.setId(999);
        activity.getFragmentManager().beginTransaction().add(ll.getId(), ChatFragment.newInstance()).commit();
        mainLayout.addView(ll);
    }
}
```

And in your onOptionsItemSelected method, you can call the goChat method like this:

```java
case R.id.action_chat:
    ChatHandler chatHandler = new ChatHandler();
    chatHandler.goChat(view, this);
    break;
```

This way, you are passing both the view that was clicked on and the activity context to the goChat method in the ChatHandler class.

Please note that it's generally not a good practice to pass the Activity context around. Instead, consider using interfaces or callbacks to communicate between different parts of your application.
